module.name: dataDumper
module.description: Acquires and stores Bottles or Images and Videos from a YARP port.

param.desc: DEPRECATED name of the listening port opened by the service
type of items to be stored. It can be bottle, image or video. Note that images are stored as ppm files. The data type video is available if OpenCV is found and the codec huffyuv is installed.

switch.desc: In case images are acquired with this option enabled, a video called 'video.avi' is also produced at the same time. This option is available if OpenCV is found and the codec \e huffyuv is installed in the system.

param.desc: With this option it is possible to reduce the storing rate by a factor n, i.e. the parameter n specifies how many items (bottles or images) shall be skipped after one acquisition.

switch.desc: If this option is on, the time of the receiving machine on which the service is running will be used as time stamp for saved data instead of the sender time.

param.desc: Optional parameter that specifies the storage directory explicitely.

input.description: port to which data to be saved is sent
emote procedure call port useful to shut down the service remotely by sending to this port the 'quit' command
